data.name: logging camp
data.description: a camp used by loggers

data.name: lost river

data.name: marina

data.name: marine channel
data.description: that part of a body of water deep enough for navigation through an area otherwise not suitable

data.name: maritime school
data.description: a school at which maritime sciences form the core of the curriculum

data.name: market
data.description: a place where goods are bought and sold at regular intervals

data.name: marsh(es)

data.name: meadow

data.name: meander neck

data.name: medical center

data.name: mesa(s)

data.name: meteorological station
data.description: a station at which weather elements are recorded

data.name: military base
data.description: a place used by an army or other armed service for storing arms and supplies, and for accommodating and training troops, a base from which operations can be initiated

data.description: a facility for use of and control by armed forces

data.name: military school
data.description: a school at which military science forms the core of the curriculum

data.name: mill(s)
data.description: a building housing machines for transforming, shaping, finishing, grinding, or extracting products

data.name: mining area

data.name: monastery

data.description: a branch of a canyon or valley

data.name: undersea fracture zone
data.description: an extensive linear zone of irregular topography of the sea floor, characterized by steep-sided or asymmetrical ridges, troughs, or escarpments

data.name: undersea furrow
data.description: a closed, linear, narrow, shallow depression

data.name: undersea gap
data.description: a narrow break in a ridge or rise

data.name: undersea gully
data.description: a small valley-like feature

data.name: undersea hill
data.description: an elevation rising generally less than 500 meters

data.name: undersea hills
data.description: elevations rising generally less than 500 meters

data.name: undersea hole
data.description: a small depression of the sea floor

data.name: undersea knoll
data.description: an elevation rising generally more than 500 meters and less than 1,000 meters and of limited extent across the summit

data.name: undersea knolls
data.description: elevations rising generally more than 500 meters and less than 1,000 meters and of limited extent across the summits

data.name: undersea ledge
data.description: a rocky projection or outcrop, commonly linear and near shore

data.name: undersea levee
data.description: an embankment bordering a canyon, valley, or seachannel

data.name: undersea median valley
data.description: the axial depression of the mid-oceanic ridge system

data.name: undersea mesa
data.description: an isolated, extensive, flat-topped elevation on the shelf, with relatively steep sides

data.name: undersea moat
data.description: an annular depression that may not be continuous, located at the base of many seamounts, islands, and other isolated elevations

data.name: undersea mound
data.description: a low, isolated, rounded hill

data.name: undersea mountain
data.description: a well-delineated subdivision of a large and complex positive feature

data.name: undersea mountains
data.description: well-delineated subdivisions of a large and complex positive feature

data.name: undersea peak
data.description: a prominent elevation, part of a larger feature, either pointed or of very limited extent across the summit

data.name: undersea peaks
data.description: prominent elevations, part of a larger feature, either pointed or of very limited extent across the summit

data.name: undersea pinnacle
data.description: a high tower or spire-shaped pillar of rock or coral, alone or cresting a summit

data.name: undersea plain
data.description: a flat, gently sloping or nearly level region

data.name: undersea plateau
data.description: a comparatively flat-topped feature of considerable extent, dropping off abruptly on one or more sides

data.name: undersea platform
data.description: a flat or gently sloping underwater surface extending seaward from the shore

data.name: undersea province
data.description: a region identifiable by a group of similar physiographic features whose characteristics are markedly in contrast with surrounding areas

data.name: undersea ramp
data.description: a gentle slope connecting areas of different elevations

data.name: undersea range
data.description: a series of associated ridges or seamounts

data.name: undersea ravine
data.description: a small canyon

data.name: undersea reef
data.description: a surface-navigation hazard composed of consolidated material

data.name: undersea reefs
data.description: surface-navigation hazards composed of consolidated material

data.name: undersea ridge
data.description: a long narrow elevation with steep sides

data.name: undersea ridges
data.description: long narrow elevations with steep sides

data.name: undersea rise
data.description: a broad elevation that rises gently, and generally smoothly, from the sea floor

data.name: undersea saddle
data.description: a low part, resembling in shape a saddle, in a ridge or between contiguous seamounts

data.name: undersea shelf
data.description: a zone adjacent to a continent (or around an island) that extends from the low water line to a depth at which there is usually a marked increase of slope towards oceanic depths

data.name: undersea shelf edge
data.description: a line along which there is a marked increase of slope at the outer margin of a continental shelf or island shelf

data.name: undersea shelf valley
data.description: a valley on the shelf, generally the shoreward extension of a canyon

data.name: undersea shoal
data.description: a surface-navigation hazard composed of unconsolidated material

data.name: undersea shoals
data.description: hazards to surface navigation composed of unconsolidated material

data.name: undersea sill
data.description: the low part of an underwater gap or saddle separating basins, including a similar feature at the mouth of a fjord

data.name: undersea slope
data.description: the slope seaward from the shelf edge to the beginning of a continental rise or the point where there is a general reduction in slope

data.name: undersea spur
data.description: a subordinate elevation, ridge, or rise projecting outward from a larger feature

data.name: undersea terrace
data.description: a relatively flat horizontal or gently inclined surface, sometimes long and narrow, which is bounded by a steeper ascending slope on one side and by a steep descending slope on the opposite side

data.name: undersea tongue
data.description: an elongate (tongue-like) extension of a flat sea floor into an adjacent higher feature

data.name: undersea trench
data.description: a long, narrow, characteristically very deep and asymmetrical depression of the sea floor, with relatively steep sides

data.name: undersea trough
data.description: a long depression of the sea floor characteristically flat bottomed and steep sided, and normally shallower than a trench

data.name: undersea valley
data.description: a relatively shallow, wide depression, the bottom of which usually has a continuous gradient

data.name: undersea valleys
data.description: a relatively shallow, wide depression, the bottom of which usually has a continuous gradient

data.name: United States Government Establishment
data.description: a facility operated by the United States Government in Panama

data.name: upland
data.description: an extensive interior region of high land with low to moderate surface relief

data.name: valley
data.description: an elongated depression usually traversed by a stream

data.name: valleys
data.description: elongated depressions usually traversed by a stream

data.name: veterinary facility
data.description: a building or camp at which veterinary services are available

data.name: vineyard
data.description: a planting of grapevines

data.name: vineyards
data.description: plantings of grapevines

data.name: volcano
data.description: a conical elevation composed of volcanic materials with a crater at the top

data.name: wadi
data.description: a valley or ravine, bounded by relatively steep banks, which in the rainy season becomes a watercourse; found primarily in North Africa and the Middle East

data.name: wadi bend
data.description: a conspicuously curved or bent segment of a wadi

data.name: wadi junction
data.description: a place where two or more wadies join

data.name: wadi mouth
data.description: the lower terminus of a wadi where it widens into an adjoining floodplain, depression, or waterbody

data.name: wadies
data.description: valleys or ravines, bounded by relatively steep banks, which in the rainy season become watercourses; found primarily in North Africa and the Middle East

data.name: wall
data.description: a thick masonry structure, usually enclosing a field or building, or forming the side of a structure

data.name: water mill
data.description: a mill powered by running water

data.name: water pumping station
data.description: a facility for pumping water from a major well or through a pipeline

data.name: water tank
data.description: a contained pool or tank of water at, below, or above ground level

data.name: watercourse
data.description: a natural, well-defined channel produced by flowing water, or an artificial channel designed to carry flowing water

data.name: waterfall(s)
data.description: a perpendicular or very steep descent of the water of a stream

data.name: waterhole(s)
data.description: a natural hole, hollow, or small depression that contains water, used by man and animals, especially in arid areas

data.name: waterworks
data.description: a facility for supplying potable water through a water source and a system of pumps and filtration beds

data.name: weir(s)
data.description: a small dam in a stream, designed to raise the water level or to divert stream flow through a desired channel

data.name: well
data.description: a cylindrical hole, pit, or tunnel drilled or dug down to a depth from which water, oil, or gas can be pumped or brought to the surface

data.name: wells
data.description: cylindrical holes, pits, or tunnels drilled or dug down to a depth from which water, oil, or gas can be pumped or brought to the surface

data.name: wetland
data.description: an area subject to inundation, usually characterized by bog, marsh, or swamp vegetation

data.name: whaling station
data.description: a facility for butchering whales and processing train oil

data.name: wharf(-ves)
data.description: a structure of open rather than solid construction along a shore or a bank which provides berthing for ships and cargo-handling facilities

data.name: whirlpool
data.description: a turbulent, rotating movement of water in a stream

data.name: wildlife reserve
data.description: a tract of public land reserved for the preservation of wildlife

data.name: windmill
data.description: a mill or water pump powered by wind

data.name: wreck
data.description: the site of the remains of a wrecked vessel

data.name: zone
data.description: zone

data.name: zoo
data.description: a zoological garden or park where wild animals are kept for exhibition

metadata.name: Location Type
metadata.description:
US NGA Feature Designation Codes
            
            On this codelist 'category' is used for the Feature Class.
